revision.text:
{{Infobox military person |name= Dragoljub Jeličić |birth_date= {{circa|1902}} |death_date= {{death year and age|1963|1902}} |birth_place= |death_place= [[Nikšić]], [[SR Montenegro]], [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia]] |image=File:Dragoljub Jelicic.jpg |caption= |allegiance={{flag|Kingdom of Serbia}}
{{flag|Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia}} |rank=[[Lance Sergeant]] |commands= |awards= |family= |spouse= |laterwork= |enteredservice= }} '''Dragoljub Jeličić''' ({{lang-sr-Cyrl|Драгољуб Јеличић}}; {{circa|1902}} – 1963) was one of the youngest soldiers in the [[Serbian Army]] during the [[First World War]]. == Biography == The Jeličić family originally lived in [[Kordun]], in present-day [[Croatia]], but emigrated as refugees to the Serbian town [[Šabac]], hoping for a better life there.{{cite news|last=Kadić|first=Veliša|title=Srpski junak od 12 godina|url=http://www.novosti.rs/vesti/naslovna/reportaze/aktuelno.293.html:479532-Srpski-junak-od-12-godina|accessdate=19 May 2014|newspaper=Večernje Novosti|date=22 February 2014}} When [[Kingdom of Serbia|Serbia]] was invaded by [[Austria-Hungary]], Dragoljub had just begun elementary school. His father was among the ones that were killed in the initial battles of the war.{{cite book|last=Levental|first=Zdenko|title=Rodolphe Archibald Reiss: criminaliste et moraliste de la Grande guerre|date=1992|publisher=L'AGE D'HOMME|location=Lausanne, Switzerland|isbn=9782825101971|pages=39–40|quote=...C'est aussi à Nis que j'ai fait connaissance d'un soldat qui devait devenir mon ami. C'est le petit Dragoljub Jelicic qui avait alors douze ans. Quand la guerre éclata, il était en classe de première au lycée de Sabac. Son père, cordonnier, était tombé lors des premiers combats. C'est alors que Dragoljub part venger son père. Il prend part aux combats, il tire, il jette des bombes. Lorsqu'il est blessé au bras et qu'on lui retire la balle, il refuse qu'on l'endorme. Sans un mot, il endure l'opération et quand elle est terminée, il prononce le plus beau juron de troupier à l'adresse des Boches. Le prince-régent Alexandre en personne lui a conféré le rang de caporal. Telle était la jeunesse serbe en 1914. Que la jeunesse actuelle apprenne à lui ressembler !... Deux jours plus tard, je partis pour Valjevo.|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=IRtFQiRteqIC&pg=PA39&dq=%22dragoljub+jelicic%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=fWN2U8STB6Oo4gT_5oHADA&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=%22dragoljub%20jelicic%22&f=false}} As the [[Austro-Hungarian Army]] approached [[Belgrade]], he participated in the attempts to defend the Serbian capital against the invading forces. Jeličić later managed to escape southwards to a unit stationed near [[Rudnik (mountain)|Rudnik]]. During a battle for the [[Mačva]] region, he was wounded while replacing a machine gunner who had been killed earlier. In [[Niš]], he befriended [[Archibald Reiss]], a professor in criminology who later would become known for his documentations of Austro-Hungarian [[war crime]]s against civilians during the [[Serbian Campaign (World War I)|occupation of Serbia]]. Reiss wrote about the encounter in his memoirs. During the war, Jeličić was personally awarded the rank of [[Corporal]] by [[Alexander I of Yugoslavia|Prince-Regent Alexander]]. Shortly before the age of fourteen, he was promoted to [[Lance Sergeant]], and he participated in the battles at the [[Salonika Front]]. He was wounded six times in total during the course of the war. After the war had ended, he worked as an actor at the theatre in [[Nikšić]].{{cite web|last=Perović|first=Dragan|title=Narodno Pozorište u Nikšiću|url=http://www.montenegrina.net/pages/pages1/film/niksicko_pozoriste2.htm|publisher=Montenegrina, digitalna biblioteka crnogorske kulture|accessdate=19 May 2014}} During the [[Axis occupation of Yugoslavia]] in the [[Second World War]], he joined the [[Yugoslav Partisan]] resistance movement. He died in Nikšić in 1963, leaving three daughters behind him. ==See also== *[[Momčilo Gavrić]] (1906–1993), youngest soldier of World War I (joined at the age of 8). ==References== {{Research help|Mil}} {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Jelicic, Dragoljub}} [[Category:1902 births]] [[Category:1963 deaths]] [[Category:People from Šabac]] [[Category:People from Nikšić]] [[Category:Serbian soldiers]] [[Category:Child soldiers]] [[Category:20th-century Serbian people]] [[Category:Serbian military personnel of World War I]] [[Category:Serbian male stage actors]] [[Category:Yugoslav male stage actors]] [[Category:Yugoslav Partisans members]] [[Category:Royal Serbian Army soldiers]]
